title: Who had the better trained army during WWII, America or Germany? - Quora

response.answer_text: Early in the War around 1940–1942, it was easily the Wehrmacht When the Americans first entered the war, they were some of the best equipped soldiers especially compared to the Germans. The Sheer material and industrial wealth was the primary reason for this. However, unlike the Germans, the Americans were inexperienced, overconfident and very poorly led. The Germans on the other hand, were veterans with most of them having seen hard combat against the French, the British and their allies in the war. The best example that illustrates this disparity was the Battle of Kasserine Pass during the African Campaign  The inexperienced and poorly led soldiers were quickly pushed back by the Germans. The results were completely disproportionate with 10000 allied soldiers(6500 of them Americans) and 183 tanks being lost, compared to the 2000 soldiers and the 34 tanks that were lost for the Germans. After this battle however, the Americans made major changes to organization, command and training with some minor changes to equipment. In the middle of the war around 1942–1943, the army was much better trained and led. At this point, they were around equal compared to Germany, with many soldiers now being veterans at this point. It was also at this time where the material wealth and industrial capability really came in play, with the Allies, bolstered by American exports beginning to overwhelm the Germans. By 1944–1945, Germany’s army was far inferior to almost all of the armies of the Allied powers. The majority of their soldiers were inexperienced and were often rushed into combat. Quite often they were forcing the women, children and elderly into combat as well. Combined with their crumbling logistics and command structure, they were very much on the back foot. America on the other hand, now had experienced commanders and soldiers along with a highly effective chain of command and logistical support. In conclusion, the entire matter went through phases. Early throughout the war, the Germans had the better trained army, although this was later equalled by the Americans in the middle of the war. Later in the war, Germany’s army was collapsing while the Americans had the better led, trained and experienced soldiers.
